alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:15PM EDT until May 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WAYNE...SOUTHWESTERN NASH...SOUTH CENTRAL EDGECOMBE...WILSON AND NORTHEASTERN JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 614 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Zebulon, or 19 miles north of Smithfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wilson, Fremont, Bailey, Kenly, Lucama, Middlesex, Stantonsburg, Black Creek, Pikeville and Saratoga. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
